fields.description:
Load up a Bamboo-enabled Studio instance then go to System Administration -> Issues -> System -> Application Links and click 'Synchronize' for Bamboo.

Now go to create a new plan in Bamboo and you will notice that the repository URL is set to file:///data/jirastudio/svn/root instead of https://test.jira.com/svn. This will cause the plan execution to fail as the EC2 instance can't access the SVN repo through a local URL.
fields.summary: Synchronising Bamboo applink from JIRA overwrites the Subversion URL with an invalid one

fields.description:
When we load https://traveltripper.jira.com/, we just get a blank system dashboard in FF 3.6, which is what the majority of our users use.  Clicking on any drop-down in that dashboard results in zero activity.

Even when I go to create an issue (which thankfully still works), auto-complete for users, etc., no longer works.
fields.summary: System dashboard appears blank, drop-downs don't work on FF 3.6
The login link in Fisheye admin login page is not redirected to JIRA login
dialog.css is referencing unavailable images

fields.description:
Recently, we've been seeing out-of-memory occurrences on a few instances.

These outages all seem to have a very similar heap dump profile.

Increasing the Xmx has just so far delayed the eventual re-occurrence of the problem.  

This is caused by Searchers being referenced on different threads, but the cleanup code assumes it is single-threaded.
fields.summary: Memory leak in quicknav search

fields.description:
The JIRA Studio Sidebar Theme does not render the code macro correctly. It does not wrap the text box.

Compare the same page with different themes:

* screenshot1 is taken with the JIRA Studio Sidebar Theme, and it does not wrap the box
* screenshot2 is taken with the default theme
fields.summary: Improve rendering for "JIRA Studio Sidebar Theme" theme

fields.description: This should fix the IllegalStateException problems fecru from [AOD-1876].
fields.summary: Upgrade fecru to 1.6.6.3

fields.description:
The changes are:
* remove "View" permission for all logged in users
* remove "Create" permission for all logged in users
* add/remove "View" permission for anonymous users
* add "View" permissions to the read groups and commit groups in the fisheye default project permissions
* add "Create" permissions to the commit groups in the fisheye default project permissions
fields.summary: Upgrade task to modify default permission scheme to match that of fisheye default project permissions

fields.description:
The permission scheme for existing projects that are using the default permission scheme
* should be copied from the updated default scheme (AOD-2139)
* should also be modified according to the fishey project permissions for the corresponding repository (root only)
fields.summary: Upgrade tasks to create crucible permission scheme for existing Studio projects that are using the default permissions scheme (No change for projects that already have a customised crucible permissions scheme)

fields.description:
Whenever a Studio project is created, a Crucible permissions scheme is copied from the default permissions scheme under the same Crucible project name and associated to the corresponding Crucible project.

The implications are:
* Changes to default permission schemes have no effect on existing projects, they only affect new projects.
* This is consistent with the behaviour of the repository default permissions. No surprise for the customers.
fields.summary: Copy and delete crucible permission scheme when Studio project is created or deleted

fields.description:

This problem is not replicable with GreenHopper in Jira standalone.

[Example|http://test.jira.com/wiki/pages/editpage.action?pageId=12648463]

fields.description:
The projecttab in JIRA performs this query:

{code}
select revisions where (comment matches 'PROJECTKEY' or p4:jobid =~ '(^|[^a-zA-Z0-9-])PROJECTKEY-[0-9]+($|[^a-zA-Z0-9-])') and date > 2009-11-24T15:43:09Z return reviews 
{code}

This can cause fisheye to heap dump OOM...possibly because too many results came back.

We can use [EyeQL|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/EyeQL+Reference+Guide] to restrict the search to a folder since each project is mapped to a single project folder in Studio.  The alternative is to use the limit clause in EyeQL.

fields.description:
Currently, an *administrator* doesn't have access to the FishEye administration screen.

This is necessary if they want to follow any of our [FishEye Best Practices|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Best+Practices+for+FishEye+Configuration] to exclude scanning certain folders after a large restructure.

Otherwise, they may experience more out-of-memory occurrences.

fields.description: Bamboo builds use "bash -c true/false" command to pass/fail the build. That doesn't work on windows
fields.summary: Bamboo func test fail on windows

fields.description:
Recently we've created a couple of JIRA Studio instances with large user bases.  These sites are unresponsive once per hour when JIRA syncs users from Crowd.  PStudio is one example.  We're ignoring alerts for first 15 minutes because it goes down so often.  We also tried to setup a JIRA instance for Hibernate and had the same performance proplem.  See [AOD-3482|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-3482] for more info.  JN and MK have informed me Crowd 2.0 has optimized Postgres calls, which will help.  But we'll have to wait for Studio 2.2.

Can anything be done in the meantime?  I'd really like to move Hibernate's JIRA instance to Studio.  What do you think about running the Crowd sync only once per day?
fields.summary: Hourly JIRA/Crowd sync performance

fields.summary: Upgrade Task v003 is failing in functional tests

fields.description:
We had a case where JIRA workflow actions went missing. This is a known problem with JIRA running on Tomcat 5.5.26 and later - [JRA-15731|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-15731].

Although the case mentions MySQL, it can affect any database server. 

We should implement this on the studio image to prevent it from affecting customers.
fields.summary: Add validation query to database connections
Bamboo mail notifications not working due to mail server misconfiguration

fields.description:
When a new studio instance is provisioned, the Admin user can log in and create a project - since they get placed in the 'administrators' and 'users' groups.

The fact they are not in the 'developers' group however, means that they can not begin creating issues, without first working this out, which would be quite difficult to do for a first time jira admin.

To get a better feel for what I mean here, deploy a clean instance of studio-gapps to googleTEST|DEV|DEMO.jira.com and then login as admin and try and create an issue after creating a new project.

Could we update the data we seed a new studio instance with, to add the admin user also to the developers jira group?
fields.summary: Admin user should be added to the Developers group in the seed data for a new Studio Instance

fields.description:
If you try to view an issue and you aren't logged in, you will get an error message asking you to login. The URL will have a parameter of the issue you just tried to view e.g. {{os_destination=%2Fbrowse%2FTST-1}}.

When you login the dashboard is shown, but you should be redirected to the issue TST-1 in the above example.
fields.summary: After logging into studio you are redirected to the dashboard despite the presence of an os_destination parameter
Fix TestQuickNavSimple

fields.description:
[This page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=184550192] should reflect the same information as [this page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Importing+Data] or be removed.

Thanks!

fields.summary: Upgrade to GreenHopper 4.2.1

fields.description:
This is a request regarding this document: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Licensing

Some customers have the misconception that, for collaborators, the source panel will be visible from the Jira issue view. They do understand that the source tab (fisheye) is not available for collaborators, but they think that from the Jira issue, they will have access to the source panel (if granted browse source permission). That is not correct.

Is there a way to make that explicitly clear?
fields.summary: Improve licensing documentation
Fix TestCommitCommentMappings test

fields.summary: Adding the group Anyone under the Global Permissions breaks licensing

fields.description: So, if we have an issue PROJECTA-123, and while fixing it commit a changeset to the source of projectb, the PROJECTA-123 issue will not get the changeset linked into its source activity stream like it would if the commit had gone into projecta's source.
fields.summary: commit messages with other project bugs aren't hooked up

fields.description: Since PMD reporting is a standard for both Java and Flex application, it would be beneficial to install the PMD plug-in found here: https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/5987
fields.summary: Install PMD Plugin for Bamboo

fields.description:
Currently Studio comes with the 1.6.14 version, which is not correctly configured for license configuration.
The Action for the license configuration is in the com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin package, but JIRA 4 only looks in com.atlassian.jira.web.action if the full action class name is not provided (which is the case in this plugin). I can reproduce this bug in my local development environment.
This affects new customers who need to set the license key.
The latest version is 1.6.64, which has been tested OK in license configuration in my local environment.
fields.summary: The Balsamiq plugin for JIRA that comes with Studio 2.0 is mal-configured for License configuration.

fields.description:
FishEye searches from the JIRA Studio header bar can result in "There was a communication problem" if the amount of time searching exceeds the intentional 30 second limit.  This is more likely to occur on large repositories.

Searches can still be done via the Source tab to confine the searches within a single project.

Filing issue to track how often this occurs.
fields.summary: Fisheye Cross repository searches can timeout in large instances

Some customers would like to use 5-character accountnames instead of the currently required 6.

(where account name forms accountname.jira.com)
fields.summary: Allow 5-character account names
When creating a new project in PStudio, it assigns 2 random(?) groups to the developers role

fields.description: The top-bar "login" link should take you to JIRA's login.jsp and not JIRA's dashboard.
fields.summary: Login links on non-JIRA apps take you to JIRA dashboard
JIRA Studio Search Aggregator and invalid XML characters search errors

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a Developer account
2. Remove the account from the 'users' group
3. Attempt to upgrade a Collaborator account to a Developer account

It should give an error about the Developer limit being reached for the licence. Also, checking the Account page should show an incorrect number of Developer accounts (i.e. the accounts not in an active group are not counted).

Active groups are: users, administrators, system-administrators and confluence-administrators.
fields.summary: Cannot add additional Developer accounts if Developer accounts that are not in an active group exist

fields.description: Inherited permissions are overridden when editing path (as opposed to project) permissions. They are overridden with blank (i.e. deny access) permissions, instead of going missing entirely as should be the case.
fields.summary: Inherited permissions overridden

fields.description: If you have a project admin, who is not also a JIRA/System Admin, then the project admin screen is kinda screwed up.
fields.summary: Project Admin screen has a bunch of links that go nowhere

fields.description: Customers would like the ability to archive and backup old projects that are no longer in use, and get a single zip file containing issues, wiki, source etc for that project in case they need to restore it later.
fields.summary: Provide a way to archive old projects

fields.description:
Names are getting double-escaped somehow.

After setting my name to "Michaél Knight" I noticed that my name in the Studio Bar was displayed as "Micha&eacute;l Knight", i.e. the "é" is shown as its HTML entity. It should display as "Michaél Knight".

The screenshot illustrates the problem.
fields.summary: Special characters display in their HTML-encoded form for the current user's name in the Studio Bar

fields.description:
The image uses {{/data/jirastudio/jira/attachments}} as the default attachment store from inspecting a few images.

But the default suggested attachments path is: {{/data/jirastudio/jira/data/attachments}}  (note the extra {{data}} folder in the path).

We sometimes have to change this path during imports so we may end up with two attachment store locations if someone starts picking the suggested default.
fields.summary: Default attachment path for JIRA

fields.description: test
fields.summary: test

fields.description:
The popup window as it currently behaves causes problems with popup-blockers and for those of us that have pop-up open in a new tab. Also, ajax modal pop-ups seem to be the standard operation procedure on websites these days.

Example 1: http://www.extjs.com/deploy/dev/examples/window/hello.html (without masking the background)
Example 2: http://www.reddit.com/ click register (masks the background).

Also No idea what priority to choose, so left it.
fields.summary: Insert/Edit Link popup window should really be an Ajax modal popup
New full name is not displayed in apps other than JIRA if the logged-in user changes full name by editing profile

fields.description:
Change user's full name to <html>.
And the user menu is shown as <html>
fields.summary: User name is not properly decoded in the user menu

fields.description:
We've had customers requesting better control over the look and feel of the navbar. Currently Studio uses JIRA's look and feel action, but that does not align very well with Studio's needs.

This would require writing a new action, hiding the old action, and updating studio-colors.vm.
fields.summary: More control over Look and Feel

fields.description: See https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/STRM-203
fields.summary: Prevent Confluence Activity Streams Provider from hanging on large Wiki pages

fields.description: Since we're using Crowd to manage users, we probably should turn this on.
fields.summary: Turn Confluence' External User Management on
The text of project, user and history menus are hidden when not hovered, if the wiki tab in global admin is selected

fields.description:
Happens with both FF and Safari. 

!http://img.skitch.com/20091223-n5pfc8in2n7f5tc73kk1a1g54r.jpg!

Happens on STAC and test.
fields.summary: Text floats over icons in the quick search popup

fields.description:
It appears this was possible at one time: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Editing+the+Colour+Scheme

This means customers can not set the Header Background Colour to white without the arrow 'disappearing'.
fields.summary: It's no longer possible to edit the colour of the Header Menu Indicator Image
Project admins can't manage tabs.

fields.description:
The Studio license page is displaying '76' as the year instead of 2010 (I assume):

!studiolicense.png!

I suspect we used the wrong symbol in the date formatting string.
fields.summary: Studio license show incorrect year in date

fields.description:
I can't manage to add gadget to the gadget directory of my JIRA Studio instance. When I click on "add gadget" the pop-up appears presenting the gadgets but no "Add gadget to Directory" button appears at the lower left corner. I'm logged as an administrator.

Is it a limitation or a bug? Do I have to enable it in the administration? Thanks for guiding me through that.

Another question : can I add external gadgets (iGoogle, RTM, Google Calendar...) to JIRA Studio or is it limited?
fields.summary: "Add gadget to Directory" button doesn't appear in Studio

fields.description: Just like Google's shared calender, it would be helpful to have a JIRA calender that can be shared across teams. This can allow for interaction between teams to see when a release is expected to roll out and when people will be out of the office during the holidays.
fields.summary: Shared Calender

fields.description:
Log off from StAC.
Open in your web browser e.g. https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10024&versions=11314&issuetype=1&environment=Java+version%3D1.6.0_17%2C+Java+vendor%3DApple+Inc.%2C+OS+name%3DMac+OS+X%2C+OS+architecture%3Di386%2C+IDEA+build+number%3DIU-93.13%2C+Plugin+version%3D2.2.1%2C+SVN%3A47015&description=ABC (this is BTW an example of URL automatically opened by all Connector for IntelliJ users who report problems directly from IntelliJ IDEA itself).
You are (correctly) asked to log in.
You log in and then get nothing: you end up on dashboard - your source URL is now lost.

Before 2.0, you correctly ended up on issue creation screen where it was enough to specify reporter and summary and submit the bug.
fields.summary: Studio 2.0 loses target URL when login is required

fields.description:
JIRA Studio administrators are concerned about how to create and manage backups, but we have no content in the administrators guide to directly address this.  There is only [this page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=203393680] in the FAQ that addresses how to backup the subversion repository.

We need to explain how a user can manage backups of their issues, wiki, code reviews, build artifacts, etc.
fields.summary: Add 'Backups' Page to the "JIRA Studio Adminstrator's Guide"

fields.description:
Since we allow customized elastic images on Bamboo, we should have instructions for customers on how to update their elastic images when Studio gets upgraded.  Otherwise, they'll encounter errors with their agents not starting up:

{code}
Exception in thread "main" java.io.InvalidClassException: com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.ElasticAgentUserDataImpl; local class incompatible: stream classdesc serialVersionUID = 8007425760037335237, local class serialVersionUID = -3465981521537969205
	at java.io.ObjectStreamClass.initNonProxy(ObjectStreamClass.java:546)
	at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readNonProxyDesc(ObjectInputStream.java:1552)
	at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readClassDesc(ObjectInputStream.java:1466)
	at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readOrdinaryObject(ObjectInputStream.java:1699)
	at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject0(ObjectInputStream.java:1305)
	at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject(ObjectInputStream.java:348)
	at com.atlassian.urlfetcher.URLFetcherImpl.fetchSerializedObject(URLFetcherImpl.java:22)
	at com.atlassian.aws.ec2.EC2Utils.getUserData(EC2Utils.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.client.RetrieveMetaData.main(RetrieveMetaData.java:25)

{code}

Also, this [page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Getting+Started+with+Bamboo+in+JIRA+Studio] probably also needs to be updated as it seems to suggest that customers can only use the default elastic image:

{quote}
* Bamboo in JIRA Studio only uses the default image supplied by Atlassian. Hence, you cannot customise the capabilities of elastic agents for Bamboo in JIRA Studio.
{quote}
fields.summary: Customized Elastic Images require manual updating during Studio upgrades

fields.description:
From customer:

When I use Road Map, then create a new issue, then click "Return to search results" - it takes me to another, different search screen.

Sometime's it then prompts to log in again:

    * pid: Anonymous users do not have permission to create issues in this project. Please try logging in first.


When I click login on that screen, I get System Error

{quote}
A system error has occurred.

Please try submitting this problem via the Support Request Page

Otherwise, please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

   1. a description of your problem
   2. cut & paste the error and system information found below 

Cause:
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot forward after response has been committed 
{quote}
fields.summary: Issues with roadmap

fields.description:
mockup plugin shipping in image appears to be old: {{mockups-1.1.78.jar}}.  

Customers reported mockups not working studio 2 upgrade.  Have been working around this with manual upload of mockups plugin.
fields.summary: Confluence bundled Mockups plugin incompatible with Studio 2.0

fields.description:
In JIRA 4.0 we upgraded to JavaMail 1.4 which supports a system property, 'mail.mime.decodeparameters', which enables more modern handling of non-ASCII mail headers.  The JIRA admin portlet is warning that this property is not set:

!adminportlet.png!

We should set this property to take advantage of the new JavaMail features and get rid of the warning.
fields.summary: 'mail.mime.decodeparameters' property should be set

fields.description:
The JIRA 4 Admin portlet displays in big red text:

bq. You do not currently have a Backup Service running. We strongly recommend you create a JIRA Backup Service.

!adminportlet.png!

This is [bad advice at the best of times|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Backing+Up+Data#BackingUpData-1.Backingupdatabasecontents], because we recommend doing backups via native database tools.  It is completely misleading in Studio, because a) we already do backups the proper way, at the database level, and b) customers can't get to the services page to create a backup service.
fields.summary: Admin portlet gives misleading warnings about a missing backup service

fields.description: I believe this is complete, but opening a ticket to track it.
fields.summary: Upgrade to JIRA 4.0.1

fields.description:
After the Studio 2.0 upgrade, all Studio instances configured to use HTTPS are receiving the "This page contains secure and nonsecure items" error when using IE6.

This happens on all JIRA pages, whether logged in or not. It does not appear on pages generated by Confluence, FishEye, etc.
fields.summary: "This page contains secure and nonsecure items" error when using IE6

fields.description:
Currently, you can access confluence, fisheye and bamboo's login screen.
We should have a single login screen across all apps in studio.

After login, we should redirect to the os_destination. Due to security policy change in JIRA 4.0, os_destination cannot be a full URL unless we relax the policy. This should not be an issue in production, but poses an issue in our development environment.
fields.summary: Redirect other apps' login page to JIRA, and redirect back to os_destination after login

fields.description:
see http://screencast.com/t/MzcwNjgxMTU

Please remove the text specific to backups.

Otherwise, please remove the admin gadget altogether, its not particularly relevant to Studio.
fields.summary: remove backup text from JIRA Admin gadget

fields.description:
I leave my browser open on the dashboard and eventually all the iframes refresh to a Tomcat security token error message:

http://screencast.com/t/NGU4YzE3M

Note that I'm still signed into JIRA as I can navigate to other pages but reloading one of these frames will give the same error.

If I simply reload the dashboard page, I still get the tokens error.

But if I force a full reload of the dashboard page, then it seems my tokens are cleared up and the dashboard appears correctly.

You can see from the error screenshot that it takes about 20 minutes to time out so you can hopefully recreate it easily, or I can if you want me to do certain tests.
fields.summary: New dashboard has security token issues

fields.description:
After the upgrade from Studio 1.8.3 to 2.0 the Greenhopper card settings reverted to blank all the special fields (I don't know what it is called) in the lower right of all the card/summary views (or the right most field on the list view).

I am resetting them manually on ours, but this could be a problem for large project installations.
fields.summary: On upgrade from Studio 1.8.3 to 2.0 lost Greenhopper card field setting
